content: मूर्च्छन {%<ab>a.</ab>%} (नी|{%<ab>f.</ab>%}) {@--1@} Stupefying, producing insensibility or stupor (an epithet applied to one of the five arrows of Cupid). {@--2@} Increasing, augmenting, strengthening. --नं, --ना [मुर्च्छ् युच्] {@--1@} Fainting, swooning. {@--2@} Prevalence, growth, increase (usually {%<ab>n.</ab>%} in this sense). {@--3@} A process in metallic preparation, calcining quicksilver with sulphur; <ab>cf.</ab> मूर्च्छा (3) also. {@--4@} (In music) The rising of sounds, an intonation, a duly regulated rise and fall of sounds conducting the air and the harmony through the keys in a pleasing manner, changing the key or passing from the key to another; modulation, melody; स्फुटीभवद्ग्रामविशेषमूर्च्छनां <ls>Śi. 1. 10</ls>; भूयो भूयः स्वयमपि कृतां मूर्च्छनां विस्मरंती <ls>Me. 86</ls>; वर्णानामपि मूर्च्छनांतरगतं तारं विरामे मृदु <ls>Mk. 3. 5</ls>; सप्त स्वरास्त्रयो ग्रामा मूर्च्छनाश्चैकबिंशतिः <ls>Pt. 5. 54</ls>; (a मूर्च्छ or मूर्च्छना is thus defined:-- क्रमात्स्वराणां सप्तानामारोहश्चावरोहणम . सा मूर्च्छेत्युच्यते ग्रामस्था एताः सप्त सप्त च .. see <ls>Malli.</ls> on <ls>Śi. 1. 10</ls> for further information).
